ontologyFramework.OFEventManagement

Class OFEventAggregation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ontologyFramework.OFEventManagement.OFEventAggregation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class OFEventAggregation
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represent the event linked to every individual belong to the ontological class "Event".

    It is based on a boolean parameterized expression given as a String. And a list of parameters that can be added or removed. All parameters are expressed in therms of instances of OFEventDefinition and they must tagged with the name used in the expression.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Buoncomapgni Luca
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • OFEventAggregation

        public OFEventAggregation(java.lang.String aggregationLow)
        Create new event with a specific boolean low as a String. This will be processed by the library MVEL on runtime and must return always a boolean value.
        Parameters:
        aggregationLow - parameterized logical relation

    • Method Detail

      • addParameter

        public void addParameter(java.lang.String varName,
                OFEventDefinition eventDef)
        Add a new parameter to the definition of this event tagged with the variable name used to define the aggregation low. This class must contains one OFEventDefinition for each name used in the String aggregationLow. (ex: "!r1 && r2") where r1 and r2 are variables.
        Parameters:
        varName - the name of the variable used in the String aggregationLow
        eventDef - initialized definition of the parameter

      • removeParameterMap

        public void removeParameterMap(java.lang.String varName)
        Remove a parameter from definition of this event.
        Parameters:
        varName - the name of the variable used in the String aggregationLow

      • clearParameterMap

        public void clearParameterMap()
        Remove all the parameters from definition of this event.

      • compute

        public boolean compute(OFBuildedListInvoker invoker)
        Compute event result. It goes for all the parameter added to this class and calls ofEventDefinition.compute( invoker). Finally, the returning boolean value is used to compute the aggregation low.
        Parameters:
        invoker - builded list of class during startup used by OFEventInterface.evaluateEvent(java.util.List, OFBuildedListInvoker)
        Returns:
        true if the event occurs in this moment
